alert.note: Alert for Gila Bend; Gila River Valley; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Southeast Yuma County; Tonopah Desert (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 7:46AM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Yuma and Maricopa Counties through 830 AM MST... At 746 AM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorms south and west of Gila Bend, moving northwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Gila Bend, Sentinel, Paloma, Freeman, Big Horn, Gila Bend Auxiliary Field, Bosque, and Hyder. This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 71 and 142. AZ Route 238 between mile markers 1 and 10. AZ Route 85 between mile markers 1 and 31, and between mile markers 119 and 127. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in Phoenix.

area.areaDesc: Gila Bend; Gila River Valley; Sonoran Desert Natl Monument; Southeast Yuma County; Tonopah Desert
